instructions: If you are not already on the website, go to https://business.apple.com/. Tap Enrol now. Enter and review the following organisation information: Data Universal Numbering System D-U-N-S Number Important: The D-U-N-S Number must match the legal name and address of the organisation. Your country or region Phone number (The phone number field is pre-populated with information from the D-U-N-S Number you entered. You can enter a new phone number if necessary.) Website URL Important: This domain is used to pre-populate Managed Apple IDs . However, if your organisation's website URL is different from your organisation's registered domain name, you can change it to your organisation's registered domain name before you create and assign Managed Apple IDs to other users of Apple Business Manager. Do not use a domain name you created, because doing so can cause all created Managed Apple IDs to fail. Time zone and language Enter and review your information: First and last name of the individual enrolling on behalf of the organisation Note: This must be a legal, human name. First and last names such as IT Coordinator or Apple Deployment will be returned to you to correct the information. A work email address which is not associated with an iTunes or iCloud account, and has not been used as an Apple ID for any other Apple service or website Role/Job title Enter and review the verification contact information. Examples include your managing director, IT director or finance director. Apple contacts your verification contact to confirm your enrolment. Name Work email address Role/Job title Tap Continue, review the information carefully, then tap Submit. Check your email for a message from Apple Business Manager with the subject line Your enrolment is in review .

Open the mail message from Apple Business Manager with the subject line Enrolment Complete . Tap the Get Started button in the message to open Safari or your default browser. To view a list of supported browsers, see Programme requirements for Apple Business Manager . Enter an email address for you to use as your Managed Apple ID . Important: This can be your work email address if you have not used it as an Apple ID before with an iTunes or iCloud account, or with any other Apple services or websites. This email address becomes your Managed Apple ID . Enter a secure password, then confirm it. Confirm your name, then enter your date of birth. Enter your SMS-enabled mobile phone number, then select how you would like to obtain secondary verification. Tap Submit. Note: You will be required to verify both your email address and your phone number. Tap the link in the mail message you received to verify your email address. Enter the SMS verification code you received on your phone, then tap Verify. Accept the terms and conditions. You must accept all terms in order to proceed.
